verses.kjv: And all the congregation of the children of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, after their journeys, according to the commandment of the LORD, and pitched in Rephidim: and there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.web: All the congregation of the children of Israel traveled from the wilderness of Sin, starting according to LORD’s commandment, and encamped in Rephidim; but there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.ct: The entire community of Israel left the wilderness of Sin, traveling from place to place as the LORD directed. They set up camp at Rephidim, but there was no water for the people to drink.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the people did chide with Moses, and said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said unto them, Why chide ye with me? wherefore do ye tempt the LORD?
verses.web: Therefore the people quarreled with Moses, and said, “Give us water to drink.” Moses said to them, “Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you test LORD?”
verses.ct: The people confronted Moses and demanded, "Give us water to drink!" Moses answered them, "Why are you fighting with me? Why are you testing the LORD?"

verses.kjv: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore is this that thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?
verses.web: The people were thirsty for water there; so the people murmured against Moses, and said, “Why have you brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us, our children, and our livestock with thirst?”
verses.ct: But the people were desperate with thirst. They complained bitterly against Moses: "Why did you bring us out of Egypt? Was it to kill us, our children, and our livestock with thirst?"

verses.kjv: And Moses cried unto the LORD, saying, What shall I do unto this people? they be almost ready to stone me.
verses.web: Moses cried to LORD, saying, “What shall I do with these people? They are almost ready to stone me.”
verses.ct: Moses cried out to the LORD, "What am I supposed to do with these people? They're about ready to stone me!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go on before the people, and take with thee of the elders of Israel; and thy rod, wherewith thou smotest the river, take in thine hand, and go.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Walk on before the people, and take the elders of Israel with you, and take the rod in your hand with which you struck the Nile, and go.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Walk out ahead of the people and bring some of the elders of Israel with you. Take the staff you used to strike the Nile, and go."

verses.kjv: Behold, I will stand before thee there upon the rock in Horeb; and thou shalt smite the rock, and there shall come water out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
verses.web: Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock in Horeb. You shall strike the rock, and water will come out of it, that the people may drink.” Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
verses.ct: "I will stand before you there on the rock at Horeb. Strike the rock, and water will pour out of it for the people to drink." Moses did exactly that, right in front of the elders of Israel.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?
verses.web: He called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because the children of Israel quarreled, and because they tested LORD, saying, “Is LORD among us, or not?”
verses.ct: He named that place Massah and Meribah — meaning "testing" and "quarreling" — because the Israelites had quarreled with him and tested the LORD by asking, "Is the LORD with us or not?"

verses.kjv: Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
verses.web: Then Amalek came and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
verses.ct: Then the Amalekites came and attacked Israel at Rephidim.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto Joshua, Choose us out men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in mine hand.
verses.web: Moses said to Joshua, “Choose men for us, and go out, fight with Amalek. Tomorrow I will stand on the top of the hill with God’s rod in my hand.”
verses.ct: Moses told Joshua, "Pick out some men and go fight the Amalekites. Tomorrow I'll stand on top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand."

verses.kjv: So Joshua did as Moses had said to him, and fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.web: So Joshua did as Moses had told him, and fought with Amalek; and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.ct: Joshua did what Moses told him and went out to fight the Amalekites. Meanwhile, Moses, Aaron, and Hur climbed to the top of the hill.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed: and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
verses.web: When Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed. When he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
verses.ct: Whenever Moses raised his hand, Israel gained the upper hand. But whenever he lowered his hand, the Amalekites started winning.

verses.kjv: But Moses’ hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat thereon; and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
verses.web: But Moses’ hands were heavy; so they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat on it. Aaron and Hur held up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side. His hands were steady until sunset.
verses.ct: Moses' arms grew heavy, so they brought a stone and set it under him to sit on. Aaron stood on one side and Hur on the other, each holding up one of his hands. His hands stayed steady until sunset.

verses.kjv: And Joshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
verses.web: Joshua defeated Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: Joshua crushed the Amalekite army with the sword.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: that I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under the sky.”
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Write this down in a book as something to be remembered, and make sure Joshua hears it: I will completely wipe out every trace of Amalek from under heaven."

verses.kjv: And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovahnissi:
verses.web: Moses built an altar, and called its name “LORD our Banner”.
verses.ct: Moses built an altar and named it Jehovahnissi — "The LORD Is My Banner."

verses.kjv: For he said, Because the LORD hath sworn that the LORD will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
verses.web: He said, “Yah has sworn: ‘LORD will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.’ ”
verses.ct: He declared, "The LORD has sworn an oath: the LORD will be at war with Amalek from generation to generation."
